---


The `#main-content` in `Layout.astro` has `padding-left: calc(280px + 3rem)` for the vertical nav, which is causing the left dark margin on the demo page. Adding a style override in `demo.astro` to remove it:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="read" data-tool-name="read_file">
<details><summary>Tool use: **read_file** • Read file: src/pages/demo.astro</summary>

</details>
</tool-use>

---



---


Adding a style override in `demo.astro` to remove the left padding causing the dark margin:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: src/pages/demo.astro</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 11, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -335,4 +335,15 @@
  
  &lt;style&gt;
+   /* Remove left padding to eliminate dark margin */
+   #main-content {
+     padding-left: 0 !important;
+   }
+ 
+   @media (max-width: 1024px) {
+     #main-content {
+       padding-left: 0 !important;
+     }
+   }
+ 
    .studio-toolbar {
      display: flex;
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---



---


Removed the left padding causing the dark margin. Added a style override in `demo.astro` to set `padding-left: 0` on `#main-content` (and at the 1024px breakpoint), overriding the layout padding for the vertical navigation.

Removed the left padding causing the dark margin. The demo page now has no left padding, so the dark margin is gone. The override applies at all screen sizes, including the 1024px breakpoint.

Updating styles to remove the dark bar, ensuring all elements are flush to the left:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: src/pages/demo.astro</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 12, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -335,6 +335,17 @@
  
  &lt;style&gt;
-   /* Remove left padding to eliminate dark margin */
+   /* Remove left padding and margin to eliminate dark bar */
    #main-content {
+     padding-left: 0 !important;
+     margin-left: 0 !important;
+   }
+ 
+   #main-content &gt; main {
+     margin-left: 0 !important;
+     padding-left: 0 !important;
+   }
+ 
+   #main-content &gt; main &gt; section {
+     margin-left: 0 !important;
      padding-left: 0 !important;
    }
```

**Chunk 2**
Lines added: 8, lines removed: undefined

Removed the dark bar by:

1. **Removed left padding and margin** from `#main-content` (which was creating space for the vertical navigation)
2. **Removed left spacing** from the nested `main` element and all sections
3. **Kept container padding** for proper content spacing (centered with auto margins)

The dark vertical bar on the left should be gone. The content is flush to the left edge, and containers maintain proper spacing for readability. The fix applies at all screen sizes.

---


The demo-login page is affected by the layout's left padding for the vertical navigation. Adding a style override to remove it:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: src/pages/demo-login.astro</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 30, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -160,4 +160,34 @@
  
  &lt;style&gt;
+   /* Remove left padding since this page doesn&#39;t have vertical navigation */
+   #main-content {
+     padding-left: 0 !important;
+     margin-left: 0 !important;
+   }
+ 
+   #main-content &gt; main {
+     margin-left: 0 !important;
+     padding-left: 0 !important;
+   }
+ 
+   #main-content &gt; main &gt; section {
+     margin-left: 0 !important;
+     padding-left: 0 !important;
+   }
+ 
+   @media (max-width: 1024px) {
+     #main-content {
+       padding-left: 0 !important;
+       margin-left: 0 !important;
+     }
+   }
+ 
+   @media (max-width: 768px) {
+     #main-content {
+       padding-left: 0 !important;
+       margin-left: 0 !important;
+     }
+   }
+ 
    .login-surface {
      min-height: 100vh;
```

</details>

</tool-use>

Fixed the demo-login page. It was inheriting the left padding from `Layout.astro` meant for pages with the vertical navigation sidebar. Since this page doesn't have the sidebar, I added a style override to remove all left padding and margins.

Updated the demo-login page to remove the black bar:

1. **Removed all left padding and margins** from `#main-content` and nested elements
2. **Made `.login-surface` extend to full viewport width** using `calc(50% - 50vw)` to break out of the container
3. **Added mobile overrides** to ensure it works on all screen sizes

The login surface should now cover the full width, eliminating the black bar on the left. The technique uses negative margins to extend beyond the container while maintaining proper content padding.

If the black bar persists, it may be a caching issue—try a hard refresh (Ctrl+F5 or Cmd+Shift+R).

Fixed the root cause. Changes:

1. **Override body background** — Changed the body background from dark (`#0a0a0a`) to match the login surface gradient, so no dark bar shows.

2. **Remove all left spacing** — Set `#main-content` and nested elements to:
   - `padding-left: 0 !important`
   - `margin-left: 0 !important`
   - `width: 100vw !important`

3. **Full-width login surface** — Made `.login-surface` extend to the full viewport width with no margins or padding.

4. **Proper container centering** — The `.login-container` inside maintains proper content spacing while the background covers the full width.

**Root cause identified:**
- The body had a dark background (`#0a0a0a`)
- `#main-content` had `padding-left: calc(280px + 3rem)` for the vertical navigation
- The login surface wasn't extending to cover that space, leaving the dark background visible

The page should now be flush to the left edge with no black bar. The content is properly centered within the full-width background.

_**User (2025-11-14 08:15Z)**_

The problem is that your main layout component is reserving space for a sidebar, which is empty on your login page.



The Cause: margin-left or padding-left

The black bar is the page's background color (likely set on the <body> tag) showing in an empty space. This space is being created by a margin-left or padding-left style that is pushing your main content to the right.



This style is almost certainly coming from your Layout.astro component, which you are importing.



Here’s the breakdown:



Shared Layout: Your project uses a main Layout.astro component and a VerticalNavigation.astro component (a sidebar).



Reserved Space: Your Layout.astro component's stylesheet likely has a rule that adds a large left margin or padding to the main content area. This is done to make room for the VerticalNavigation so the content doesn't load underneath the sidebar.



Somewhere in your project (probably Layout.astro or a global CSS file), you have a style like:



CSS



/* This is the CAUSE (likely in another file) */

main {

  margin-left: 250px; /* Or some other value */

}

The "Fix" You Pasted: The <style> block you included in your file is trying to override this default behavior. The comment you have /* Remove left padding and margin to eliminate dark bar */ confirms this.



CSS



<style>

  /* This is your FIX, not the cause */

  #main-content {

    padding-left: 0 !important;

    margin-left: 0 !important;

  }

...

</style>

The image you sent is your login page, which uses this same layout. However, since there is no sidebar on the login page, you are left with the empty, reserved space, which just shows the black body background.



The code you sent is for the logged-in page, and it includes the CSS fix to remove that empty space. If the black bar is still appearing on the login page, it's because the login page's file (e.g., demo-login.astro) does not include this CSS override.

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_



---


The Layout component reserves space for the sidebar, but the login page doesn't have one. Adding the CSS override to remove that space:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="read" data-tool-name="read_file">
<details><summary>Tool use: **read_file** • Read file: src/pages/demo-login.astro</summary>

</details>
</tool-use>

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: src/pages/demo-login.astro</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 26, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -160,8 +160,34 @@
  
  &lt;style&gt;
+   /* Fix: Remove left padding reserved for sidebar since login page doesn&#39;t have one */
+   #main-content {
+     padding-left: 0 !important;
+     margin-left: 0 !important;
+   }
+ 
+   #main-content &gt; main {
+     margin-left: 0 !important;
+     padding-left: 0 !important;
+   }
+ 
+   @media (max-width: 1024px) {
+     #main-content {
+       padding-left: 0 !important;
+       margin-left: 0 !important;
+     }
+   }
+ 
+   @media (max-width: 768px) {
+     #main-content {
+       padding-left: 0 !important;
+       margin-left: 0 !important;
+     }
+   }
+ 
    .login-surface {
      min-height: 100vh;
      background: linear-gradient(135deg, #f9fafb 0%, #ffffff 45%, #eef3ff 100%);
      color: #111111;
+     width: 100%;
    }
  
```

</details>

</tool-use>

          <summary>Tool use: **read_lints** • Read lints for 1 file</summary>

---



---


Added the fix to remove the left padding reserved for the sidebar. The Layout component sets `padding-left: calc(280px + 3rem)` on `#main-content` for the vertical navigation, but the login page doesn't have that sidebar, so the space shows the dark background.

The fix:
1. **Removes the left padding and margin** from `#main-content` (the reserved sidebar space)
2. **Removes spacing from the nested main element** as well
3. **Includes responsive breakpoints** to ensure it works on all screen sizes
4. **Keeps it minimal** - only what's needed to fix the issue

This removes the black bar on the left without affecting the footer or other page elements. The login page will now use the full width without the reserved sidebar space.

---
